1:
Yahweh, God who avenges,\q God who avenges, shine over us.
\q
2:
Rise up, judge of the earth,\q give to the proud what they deserve.


\q
3:
How long will the wicked, Yahweh,\q how long will the wicked rejoice?
\q
4:
They pour out their arrogant words;\q all those who do evil boast.


\q
5:
They crush your people, Yahweh;\q they afflict the nation that belongs to you.
\q
6:
They kill the widow and foreigner who lives in their country,\q and they murder the fatherless.
\q
7:
They say, "Yahweh will not see,\q the God of Jacob does not take notice of it."


\q
8:
Understand, you stupid people!\q You fools, when will you ever learn?
\q
9:
He who made the ear, does he not hear?\q He who formed the eye, does he not see?


\q
10:
He who disciplines the nations, does he not correct?\q He is the one who gives knowledge to man.
\q
11:
Yahweh knows the thoughts of men,\q that they are vapor.


\q
12:
Blessed is the one whom you instruct, Yahweh,\q the one whom you teach from your law.
\q
13:
You give him rest in times of trouble\q until a pit is dug for the wicked.


\q
14:
For Yahweh will not forsake his people\q or abandon his inheritance.
\q
15:
For judgment will again be righteous;\q and all the upright in heart will follow it.
\q
16:
Who will rise up to defend me against the evildoers?\q Who will stand up for me against the wicked?


\q
17:
Unless Yahweh had been my help,\q I would soon be lying down in the place of silence.
\q
18:
When I said, "My foot is slipping,"\q Your covenant faithfulness, Yahweh, held me up.
\q
19:
When cares within me are many, your consolations make me happy.

\q
20:
Can a throne of destruction be allied with you,\q one who creates injustice by statute?
\q
21:
They conspire together to take the life of the righteous\q and they condemn the innocent to death.


\q
22:
But Yahweh has been my high tower,\q and my God has been the rock of my refuge.
\q
23:
He will bring on them their own iniquity\q and will cut them off in their own wickedness.
\q Yahweh our God will cut them off.
